# Elasticities {background-color="#62259D"}


## Elasticities 

<br>

To [quantify]{.hi-green} consumer behavior &rarr; [elasticity]{.note}

. . .


<br><br>

The most common elasticity category is the ***price elasticity***. 


. . .

<br>


Suppose a [change in the price]{.note} of a good/service:

. . .

- *Large change* in the quantity demanded?

- *Small change* in the quantity demanded?


## Elasticities 

<br><br>

$$
\text{Price elasticity of demand} = \dfrac{\Delta Q}{\Delta P}
$$

. . .

<br><br><br>

Elasticity is all about [proportional changes]{.hi-purple}.


## Elasticities 

<br>

[What influences the demand elasticity?]{.note}

. . .

<br><br>

- [Necessity]{.hi-orange} or [luxury]{.hi-green}?

. . .

- Good [substitutes]{.hi-slate}?

. . .

- Can it be [postponed]{.hi}?

# Income elasticity {background-color="#62259D"}



## Income elasticity 

<br>


The **income elasticity of demand** is the percentage change in the quantity demanded following a *percentage change in income.* 

. . .

<br>



$$
\text{Income elasticity of demand} = \dfrac{\Delta Q}{\Delta I}
$$
